newsitem.title: GREECE: Greek stocks close 0.73pct higher, banks lead.
newsitem.headline: Greek stocks close 0.73pct higher, banks lead.

text.p: Greek equities ended 0.73 percent higher on Tuesday with fund managers expecting the market to consolidate around 1,250 to 1,300 points in the short term, after recent strong fluctuations in the benchmark index.

"We should get used to these levels. The recent strong rise of the bourse, followed by a sharp fall fall and then a rebound has led to an interim consolidation phase," said fund manager George Vendouratos, at Aspis Mutual Funds.
"I do not think that institutional investors that have found stocks attractive up to now will suddenly turn to bonds," he said.
The Athens general share index settled 0.73 percent or 9.48 points higher at 1300.76 points from Monday's 1291.28 after opening at 1293.34.
Turnover was 9.7 billion drachmas on volume of 3.0 million shares. Decliners led advancers 128 to 87 with 26 issues unchanged on 241 traded.
Banks rose 1.25 percent and construction stocks closed 0.81 percent lower. Leasing shares settled 0.52 percent higher.
Industrials closed 0.53 percent up, while insurance lost 0.59 percent along with small caps, down 0.67 percent.
